meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of prototrophy.
meanings.sent1: The prototrophic bacteria thrived in the simple environment.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the prototrophic organisms in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent3: The prototrophic plants had a party in the nutrient-rich soil.
meanings.sent4: Her prototrophic mindset allowed her to adapt to any situation.
meanings.sent5: The prototrophic nature of the organism made it resilient to changes.

meanings.definition: Capable of growing on a minimal medium without the addition of specific nutrients.
meanings.sent1: The prototrophic cells multiplied rapidly in the basic solution.
meanings.sent2: The prototrophic bacteria thrived in the nutrient-deficient environment.
meanings.sent3: The prototrophic yeast threw a celebration in the simple broth.
meanings.sent4: His prototrophic abilities made him self-sufficient in any condition.
meanings.sent5: The prototrophic plant's growth was unaffected by the lack of nutrients.
